triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core technology integrated into multi-agent systems to provide cognitive abilities for autonomous problem-solving in software engineering.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems provide the collaborative framework for coordinating multiple specialized agents to solve complex software engineering challenges.

triples.name: Software engineering
triples.relevance: Software engineering is the primary application domain for LLM-based multi-agent systems in the paper's focus.

triples.name: Systems development life cycle
triples.relevance: The paper maps LMA applications across various stages of the SDLC, making it a key organizing framework for the review.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: Autonomous agents are the fundamental units within multi-agent systems that perform problem-solving and decision-making tasks independently.
